meanings.definition: To make a statement that is too general and does not account for exceptions or variations.
meanings.sent1: She overgeneralized by saying all cats are mean.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overgeneralize when talking about sports teams.
meanings.sent3: The comedian overgeneralized about how all parents are bad at technology.
meanings.sent4: Her conclusion was overgeneralized, like trying to fit a square peg in a round hole.
meanings.sent5: The teacher warned against overgeneralizing, comparing it to painting with a broad brush.

meanings.definition: To apply a general rule or idea to a wide range of situations without considering individual differences.
meanings.sent1: They overgeneralized the marketing strategy to all demographics.
meanings.sent2: It's easy to overgeneralize when making assumptions about people.
meanings.sent3: The chef overgeneralized by using the same seasoning on every dish.
meanings.sent4: His advice was overgeneralized, like trying to use a one-size-fits-all solution.
meanings.sent5: The concept of overgeneralizing was explained using a simple analogy of coloring outside the lines.
